wiki.text:
In mathematics, the qualifier 'pointwise' is used to indicate that a certain
property is defined by considering each value <math>f(x)</math> of some function
<math>f.</math> An important class of pointwise concepts are the pointwise
operations — operations defined on functions by applying the operations to
function values separately for each point in the domain of definition. Important
relations can also be defined pointwise.
wiki.title: pointwise
